description: Creates a new Neptune Analytics graph and imports data into it, either from Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) or from a Neptune database or a Neptune database snapshot. The data can be loaded from files in S3 that in either the Gremlin CSV format or the openCypher load format.

parameters.name: graphName
parameters.description: A name for the new Neptune Analytics graph to be created. The name must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens, and its first character must be a letter. It cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens. Only lowercase letters are allowed.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Adds metadata tags to the new graph. These tags can also be used with cost allocation reporting, or used in a Condition statement in an IAM policy. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: vectorSearchConfiguration
parameters.description: Specifies the number of dimensions for vector embeddings that will be loaded into the graph. The value is specified as ``dimension=``value. Max = 65,535 The number of dimensions.

parameters.name: replicaCount
parameters.description: The number of replicas in other AZs to provision on the new graph after import. Default = 0, Min = 0, Max = 2.

parameters.name: importOptions
parameters.description: Contains options for controlling the import process. For example, if the failOnError key is set to false, the import skips problem data and attempts to continue (whereas if set to true, the default, or if omitted, the import operation halts immediately when an error is encountered. neptune (dict) --- Options for importing data from a Neptune database. The path to an S3 bucket from which to import data. The KMS key to use to encrypt data in the S3 bucket where the graph data is exported preserveDefaultVertexLabels (boolean) --- Neptune Analytics supports label-less vertices and no labels are assigned unless one is explicitly provided. Neptune assigns default labels when none is explicitly provided. When importing the data into Neptune Analytics, the default vertex labels can be omitted by setting preserveDefaultVertexLabels to false. Note that if the vertex only has default labels, and has no other properties or edges, then the vertex will effectively not get imported into Neptune Analytics when preserveDefaultVertexLabels is set to false. preserveEdgeIds (boolean) --- Neptune Analytics currently does not support user defined edge ids. The edge ids are not imported by default. They are imported if preserveEdgeIds is set to true, and ids are stored as properties on the relationships with the property name neptuneEdgeId.

nested_params.name: neptune
nested_params.description: Options for importing data from a Neptune database.

nested_params.name: s3ExportPath
nested_params.description: The path to an S3 bucket from which to import data.

nested_params.name: s3ExportKmsKeyId
nested_params.description: The KMS key to use to encrypt data in the S3 bucket where the graph data is exported.

nested_params.name: preserveDefaultVertexLabels
nested_params.description: Neptune Analytics supports label-less vertices and no labels are assigned unless one is explicitly provided. Neptune assigns default labels when none is explicitly provided. When importing the data into Neptune Analytics, the default vertex labels can be omitted by setting preserveDefaultVertexLabels to false. Note that if the vertex only has default labels, and has no other properties or edges, then the vertex will effectively not get imported into Neptune Analytics when preserveDefaultVertexLabels is set to false.

nested_params.name: preserveEdgeIds
nested_params.description: Neptune Analytics currently does not support user defined edge ids. The edge ids are not imported by default. They are imported if preserveEdgeIds is set to true, and ids are stored as properties on the relationships with the property name neptuneEdgeId.

parameters.name: maxProvisionedMemory
parameters.description: The maximum provisioned memory-optimized Neptune Capacity Units (m-NCUs) to use for the graph. Default: 1024, or the approved upper limit for your account. If both the minimum and maximum values are specified, the final provisioned-memory will be chosen per the actual size of your imported data. If neither value is specified, 128 m-NCUs are used.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: A URL identifying to the location of the data to be imported. This can be an Amazon S3 path, or can point to a Neptune database endpoint or snapshot.

parameters.name: roleArn
parameters.description: The ARN of the IAM role that will allow access to the data that is to be imported.

nested_items.name: graphId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the Neptune Analytics graph.

nested_items.name: taskId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the import task.

nested_items.name: source
nested_items.description: A URL identifying to the location of the data to be imported. This can be an Amazon S3 path, or can point to a Neptune database endpoint or snapshot.

nested_items.name: format
nested_items.description: Specifies the format of S3 data to be imported. Valid values are CSV, which identifies the Gremlin CSV format, OPENCYPHER, which identifies the openCypher load format, or ntriples, which identifies the RDF n-triples format.

nested_items.name: parquetType
nested_items.description: The parquet type of the import task.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that will allow access to the data that is to be imported.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the import task.

nested_items.name: importOptions
nested_items.description: Contains options for controlling the import process. For example, if the failOnError key is set to false, the import skips problem data and attempts to continue (whereas if set to true, the default, or if omitted, the import operation halts immediately when an error is encountered.

nested_items.name: s3ExportPath
nested_items.description: The path to an S3 bucket from which to import data.

nested_items.name: s3ExportKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The KMS key to use to encrypt data in the S3 bucket where the graph data is exported.

nested_items.name: preserveDefaultVertexLabels
nested_items.description: Neptune Analytics supports label-less vertices and no labels are assigned unless one is explicitly provided. Neptune assigns default labels when none is explicitly provided. When importing the data into Neptune Analytics, the default vertex labels can be omitted by setting preserveDefaultVertexLabels to false. Note that if the vertex only has default labels, and has no other properties or edges, then the vertex will effectively not get imported into Neptune Analytics when preserveDefaultVertexLabels is set to false.

nested_items.name: preserveEdgeIds
nested_items.description: Neptune Analytics currently does not support user defined edge ids. The edge ids are not imported by default. They are imported if preserveEdgeIds is set to true, and ids are stored as properties on the relationships with the property name neptuneEdgeId.
